member.name: F:WindowsApplication1.ResolveLNK.SLGP_FLAGS.SLGP_SHORTPATH
member.summary: Retrieves the standard short (8.3 format) file name

member.name: F:WindowsApplication1.ResolveLNK.SLGP_FLAGS.SLGP_UNCPRIORITY
member.summary: Retrieves the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path name of the file

member.name: F:WindowsApplication1.ResolveLNK.SLGP_FLAGS.SLGP_RAWPATH
member.summary: Retrieves the raw path name. A raw path is something that might not exist and may include environment variables that need to be expanded

member.name: F:WindowsApplication1.ResolveLNK.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NO_UI
member.summary: Do not display a dialog box if the link cannot be resolved. When SLR_NO_UI is set, the high-order word of fFlags can be set to a time-out value that specifies the maximum amount of time to be spent resolving the link. The function returns if the link cannot be resolved within the time-out duration. If the high-order word is set to zero, the time-out duration will be set to the default value of 3,000 milliseconds (3 seconds). To specify a value, set the high word of fFlags to the desired time-out duration, in milliseconds.

member.name: F:WindowsApplication1.ResolveLNK.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_ANY_MATCH
member.summary: Obsolete and no longer used

member.name: F:WindowsApplication1.ResolveLNK.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_UPDATE
member.summary: If the link object has changed, update its path and list of identifiers. If SLR_UPDATE is set, you do not need to call IPersistFile::IsDirty to determine whether or not the link object has changed.

member.name: F:WindowsApplication1.ResolveLNK.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOUPDATE
member.summary: Do not update the link information

member.name: F:WindowsApplication1.ResolveLNK.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOSEARCH
member.summary: Do not execute the search heuristics

member.name: F:WindowsApplication1.ResolveLNK.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOTRACK
member.summary: Do not use distributed link tracking

member.name: F:WindowsApplication1.ResolveLNK.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOLINKINFO
member.summary: Disable distributed link tracking. By default, distributed link tracking tracks removable media across multiple devices based on the volume name. It also uses the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path to track remote file systems whose drive letter has changed. Setting SLR_NOLINKINFO disables both types of tracking.

member.name: F:WindowsApplication1.ResolveLNK.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_INVOKE_MSI
member.summary: Call the Microsoft Windows Installer

member.name: T:WindowsApplication1.RegistryOwnership.TOKEN_PRIVILEGES
member.remarks: Adjust SizeConst for uses beyond original design

member.name: M:WindowsApplication1.RegistryOwnership.LookupPrivilegeValue(System.String,System.String,WindowsApplication1.RegistryOwnership.LUID@)
member.param: The system to find the privilege for. Use Nothing for the local computer.
The name of the privilege to lookup
member.returns: True for success; false for failure. Use Marshal.GetLastWin32Error to determine error code.

member.name: M:WindowsApplication1.RegistryOwnership.AdjustTokenPrivileges(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean,WindowsApplication1.RegistryOwnership.TOKEN_PRIVILEGES@,System.Int32,WindowsApplication1.RegistryOwnership.TOKEN_PRIVILEGES@,System.IntPtr@)
member.param: TOKEN_PRIVILEGES structure with desired privilege set.
Size of the structure that will be passed in the PreviousState parameter.
TOKEN_PRIVILEGES structure to hold the user's privileges as they were prior to this function call.
OUT: The size of the PreviousState variable after the function runs, or in the event of an error, the minimum size that the PreviousState variable should have been.
member.returns: 0 for success, a non-zero error code that can initialize a new Win32Exception for errorchecking.

member.name: M:WindowsApplication1.RegistryOwnership.SetNamedSecurityInfo(System.String,WindowsApplication1.RegistryOwnership.SE_OBJECT_TYPE,WindowsApplication1.RegistryOwnership.SECURITY_INFORMATION,System.Byte[],System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.param: Flag indicating which security item(s) will be modified.
SID of the new owner, if ownership is changing.
SID of the object's primary group, if it is changing.
Discretionary access list to be set on the object, if it is changing.
Security access list to be set on the object, if it is changing.
member.returns: 0 for success, a non-zero error code that can initialize a new Win32Exception for errorchecking.

member.name: T:WindowsApplication1.RegistryOwnership.BaseKeySelector
member.remarks: .Net functions typically use the HKEY_ prefix while the SetNamedSecurityInfo used here does not, so this can help avoid confusion.

member.name: M:WindowsApplication1.RegistryOwnership.SeizeRegistryKey(WindowsApplication1.RegistryOwnership.BaseKeySelector,System.String@,System.String@)
member.param: An enumerator that indicates which registry base key to work with.
This string will be populated with any error conditions that the function traps.
member.returns: True if the function succeeed. If False, check the value of ErrorMessage.
